alert.note: Alert for Montour (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 09 at 7:03PM EST until January 11 at 5:18AM EST by NWS State College
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 PM EST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by rain and snowmelt is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central Pennsylvania, including the following counties, Montour and Northumberland. * WHEN...Until 1100 PM EST. * IMPACTS...Water over roadways. Overflowing poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 658 PM EST, rain and snowmelt is occurring, and will cause minor flooding. Between 0.5 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - A front pushing through from the west by 8 PM EST will end the heavy rainfall. Any additional showers tonight will be lighter. Additional rainfall of one-half of an inch is expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Washingtonville, Danville, Sunbury, Turbotville, and Pottsgrove. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
